reviewText: I loved the Land before Time and despite a few clinkers, this was a fairly good series based on that movie. In this double feature, we are introduced to Chomper, a young T-Rex that was raised by Little Foot and friends when his egg was accidently taken by the gang when they tried to rescue an egg taken by Egg stealers from the nest of Duckie's mother. Little Foot learns responsibility when he realizes that no matter what Chomper is, he's still a baby and needs help to survive, and when he discovers Chomper's real parents, that not all T-Rexes are bad creatures and are very capable of gratitude. This is also the same in the second feature when their food is eaten by Leaf gobblers and they find themselves trapped on a mysterious island after the land bridge they took is washed away in a tsunami. They discover the island is home to the Sharp teeth and they fear being eaten, until they discover one of the inhabitants is Chomper who helps them hide and even tries to find them things to eat. When they are attacked by another Sharp tooth, The Parents come to the rescue and Chomper winds up in the water where Little Foot tries to rescue him. A surprising sea creature turns up to help and Little Foot and the gang gets home again, while Chomper remains behind with his parents after promising to remain friends with the little T- Rex. The songs are catchy and lively and my personal favorite is "Friends for Dinner", sung in the second feature.

reviewText: I found all 13 of  The Land Before Time, as a set.  I have watched this with my children and now their children.  we had a great time watching together and having all of them, now one is not replayed over and over.  These movies teach values of life in a friendly format that even very young children can understand.
